benchmark_details.name: MindBench
benchmark_details.overview: MindBench is a comprehensive benchmark designed for the structural analysis and parsing of mind maps, including bilingual dataset of high-resolution images with detailed annotations and evaluation metrics, covering five structured understanding and parsing tasks.
benchmark_details.data_type: bilingual mind map images with annotations

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a standardized tool for research in structured document analysis, focusing on mind maps.

data.source: Data generated from mind map files and synthetic data.
data.size: 21,527 examples in crawled dataset, 400,000 examples in synthetic dataset
data.annotation: Parsed from real mind map files and synthesized using automated processes.

methodology.calculation: Precision and recall calculated for F1 score evaluation; TED is calculated using the Zhang-Shasha algorithm.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better model performance in understanding and structuring mind maps.
methodology.baseline_results: Performance benchmarks established using various visual document understanding models.
methodology.validation: Models evaluated on test sets of various complexities and tasks.
